page.title: 16WALKING IN ACTON
page.content: On the Domesday walks we have covered about four square kilometres of land. The fields mostly have pasture in them.Sometimes the pasture is used for silage and sometimes hay.We saw wheat and barley and some new grown maize. There was rape aswell,rape has yellow flowers and it is crushed to make oil. We also went to the church and up the tower.You can see a moat from the top. We are going to the moat when we get permission. When we walked down Ravens Lane we saw some wheat and some pasture.We saw a farm called Madams farm.We saw maize growing on Dig Lane.We got to Dig Lane by Swanley Lane and past Dorfold dairy house farm.When we went up Monks Lane we past a moat,we past two dead magpies.
